page.title: 04(CONT.) GLASSHAMPTON
page.content:
One futher part of Astley, also not in the block, deserves mention. Almost 1km due South of the church lies {GLASSHAMPTON MONASTERY,}which now belongs to the{Society of St. Francis, an Anglican order. It has been a religious house since{1920}and was established in its present form in {1947.}The stables and gardens are all that remain of a large mansion, burnt down in 1810, built on an ancient site mentioned in the Domesday Book.
The Brothers are familiar figures in the area, and help to take services at the local churches. Their Christmas Eve Midnight Communion is attended by neighbouring villagers.
